001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.util.ServiceLoader;
005import java.util.function.Supplier;
006
007import io.jstach.jstache.JStache;
008import io.jstach.jstachio.spi.AbstractJStachio;
009import io.jstach.jstachio.spi.JStachioConfig;
010import io.jstach.jstachio.spi.JStachioExtension;
011import io.jstach.jstachio.spi.JStachioFactory;
012
013/**
014 * Render models by using reflection to lookup generated templates as well as apply
015 * filtering and fallback mechanisms.
016 * <h2>Example Usage</h2> <pre><code class="language-java">
017 * &#64;JStache(template = "Hello {{name}}!")
018 * public record HelloWorld(String name) {}
019 *
020 * public static String output(String name) {
021 *   //Normally you would have to use generated class HelloWorldRenderer
022 *   //but this JStachio allows you to render directly
023 *   //from the model.
024 *   return JStachio.render(new HelloWorld(name));
025 * }
026 * </code> </pre> Not only is the above more convenient than using the raw generated code
027 * it also allows additional custom runtime behavior like filtering as well as allows
028 * easier integration with web frameworks.
029 *
030 * <h2>Customize</h2>
031 *
032 * The default {@link JStachio} uses the {@link ServiceLoader} to load
033 * {@link JStachioExtension}s. You can customize it by adding jars that have provided
034 * {@link JStachioExtension}s or by {@link JStachioConfig adjusting config}.
035 *
036 * <p>
037 *
038 * If you would like to create your own {@link JStachio} instead of the default you can
039 * either extend {@link AbstractJStachio} or use {@link JStachioFactory#builder()}. If you
040 * want your custom {@link JStachio} to be set as the default such that the static render
041 * methods on this class call it you can do that with {@link #setStatic(Supplier)}.
042 *
043 * @apiNote The static <strong><code>render</code></strong> methods are convenience
044 * methods that will by default use the ServiceLoader based JStachio which loads all
045 * extensions via the {@link ServiceLoader}.
046 * @see JStachioExtension
047 * @see JStache
048 * @see JStachioFactory#builder()
049 */
050public interface JStachio extends Renderer<Object> {
051
052        /**
053         * Finds a template by using the models class if possible and then applies filtering
054         * and then finally render the model by writing to the appendable.
055         * <p>
056         * {@inheritDoc}
057         */
058        void execute(Object model, Appendable appendable) throws IOException;
059
060        /**
061         * Finds a template by using the models class if possible and then applies filtering
062         * and then finally render the model by writing to the {@link StringBuilder}.
063         * <p>
064         * {@inheritDoc}
065         */
066        StringBuilder execute(Object model, StringBuilder sb);
067
068        /**
069         * Finds a template by using the models class if possible and then applies filtering
070         * and then finally render the model to a String.
071         * <p>
072         * {@inheritDoc}
073         */
074        String execute(Object model);
075
076        /**
077         * Determines if this jstachio can render the model type (the class annotated by
078         * JStache).
079         * @param modelType the models class (<em>the one annotated with {@link JStache} and
080         * not the Templates class</em>)
081         * @return true if this jstachio can render instances of modelType
082         */
083        boolean supportsType(Class<?> modelType);
084
085        /**
086         * Executes the ServiceLoader instance of JStachio
087         * {@link #execute(Object, Appendable)}.
088         * @param model never <code>null</code>
089         * @param a appendable never <code>null</code>
090         * @throws IOException if there is an error using the appendable
091         * @see #execute(Object, Appendable)
092         */
093        public static void render(Object model, Appendable a) throws IOException {
094                of().execute(model, a);
095        }
096
097        /**
098         * Executes the ServiceLoader instance of JStachio
099         * {@link #execute(Object, StringBuilder)}.
100         * @param model never <code>null</code>
101         * @param a appendable never <code>null</code>
102         * @return the passed in {@link StringBuilder}
103         * @see #execute(Object, StringBuilder)
104         */
105        public static StringBuilder render(Object model, StringBuilder a) {
106                return of().execute(model, a);
107        }
108
109        /**
110         * Executes the ServiceLoader instance of JStachio {@link #execute(Object)}.
111         * @param model the root context model. Never <code>null</code>.
112         * @return the rendered string.
113         * @see #execute(Object)
114         */
115        public static String render(Object model) {
116                return of().execute(model);
117        }
118
119        /**
120         * Gets the static singleton jstachio.
121         * @return the jstachio from {@link #setStatic(Supplier)}
122         * @throws NullPointerException if jstachio is not found
123         * @see #setStatic(Supplier)
124         */
125        public static JStachio of() {
126                JStachio jstachio = JStachioHolder.get();
127                if (jstachio == null) {
128                        throw new NullPointerException("JStachio not found. This is probably a classloading issue.");
129                }
130                return jstachio;
131        }
132
133        /**
134         * Gets default singleton ServiceLoader based jstachio.
135         * @return service loaded jstachio
136         */
137        public static JStachio defaults() {
138                return io.jstach.jstachio.spi.JStachioFactory.defaultJStachio();
139        }
140
141        /**
142         * Set the static singleton of JStachio.
143         * <p>
144         * Useful if you would like to avoid using the default ServiceLoader mechanism.
145         * @param jstachioProvider if null a NPE will be thrown.
146         * @apiNote the provider will be called on every call of {@link #of()} and thus to
147         * avoid constant recreation it is recommend the supplier be memoized/cached.
148         */
149        public static void setStatic(Supplier<JStachio> jstachioProvider) {
150                if (jstachioProvider == null) {
151                        throw new NullPointerException("JStachio provider cannot be null");
152                }
153                JStachioHolder.provider = jstachioProvider;
154        }
155
156}
157
158final class JStachioHolder {
159
160        static Supplier<JStachio> provider = JStachio::defaults;
161
162        static JStachio get() {
163                return provider.get();
164        }
165
166}
